alert.note: Alert for Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 14 at 7:50PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern La Paz and north central Yuma Counties through 815 PM MST... At 749 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles west of Kofa Wildlife Refuge, or 39 miles northeast of Martinez Lake, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quartzsite, Kofa Wildlife Refuge and Palm Canyon. This includes the following highways... AZ Route 95 between mile markers 69 and 103. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central La Paz; Gila River Valley; Kofa
